channel.title: Papers with Code: Greatest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: tensorflow
item.description: An Open Source Machine Learning Framework for Everyone

item.title: transformers
item.description: Transformers: State-of-the-art Machine Learning for Pytorch, TensorFlow, and JAX.

item.title: Fine-mixing: Mitigating Backdoors in Fine-tuned Language Models
item.description: In this work, we take the first step to exploit the pre-trained (unfine-tuned) weights to mitigate backdoors in fine-tuned language models.

item.title: Chain-of-Thought Prompt Distillation for Multimodal Named Entity Recognition and Multimodal Relation Extraction
item.description: Multimodal Named Entity Recognition (MNER) and Multimodal Relation Extraction (MRE) necessitate the fundamental reasoning capacity for intricate linguistic and multimodal comprehension.

item.title: pytorch
item.description: Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU acceleration

item.title: models
item.description: Models and examples built with TensorFlow

item.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: By decomposing the image formation process into a sequential application of denoising autoencoders, diffusion models (DMs) achieve state-of-the-art synthesis results on image data and beyond.

item.title: Gender Classification and Bias Mitigation in Facial Images
item.description: We worked to increase classification accuracy and mitigate algorithmic biases on our baseline model trained on the augmented benchmark database.

item.title: Gender Classification from Iris Texture Images Using a New Set of Binary Statistical Image Features
item.description: This paper explores the use of a Binary Statistical Features (BSIF) algorithm for classifying gender from iris texture images captured with NIR sensors.

item.title: Analyzing Covariate Influence on Gender and Race Prediction from Near-Infrared Ocular Images
item.description: Recent research has explored the possibility of automatically deducing information such as gender, age and race of an individual from their biometric data.

item.title: GPT4All: An Ecosystem of Open Source Compressed Language Models
item.description: It is our hope that this paper acts as both a technical overview of the original GPT4All models as well as a case study on the subsequent growth of the GPT4All open source ecosystem.

item.title: Politeness Transfer: A Tag and Generate Approach
item.description: This paper introduces a new task of politeness transfer which involves converting non-polite sentences to polite sentences while preserving the meaning.

item.title: CrossWOZ: A Large-Scale Chinese Cross-Domain Task-Oriented Dialogue Dataset
item.description: To advance multi-domain (cross-domain) dialogue modeling as well as alleviate the shortage of Chinese task-oriented datasets, we propose CrossWOZ, the first large-scale Chinese Cross-Domain Wizard-of-Oz task-oriented dataset.

item.title: MaskNet: Introducing Feature-Wise Multiplication to CTR Ranking Models by Instance-Guided Mask
item.description: We also turn the feed-forward layer in DNN model into a mixture of addictive and multiplicative feature interactions by proposing MaskBlock in this paper.

item.title: Adapting Large Language Model with Speech for Fully Formatted End-to-End Speech Recognition
item.description: Most end-to-end (E2E) speech recognition models are composed of encoder and decoder blocks that perform acoustic and language modeling functions.

item.title: A ConvNet for the 2020s
item.description: The "Roaring 20s" of visual recognition began with the introduction of Vision Transformers (ViTs), which quickly superseded ConvNets as the state-of-the-art image classification model.

item.title: RegNet: Self-Regulated Network for Image Classification
item.description: The ResNet and its variants have achieved remarkable successes in various computer vision tasks.

item.title: Adapting the Tesseract Open Source OCR Engine for Multilingual OCR
item.description: We describe efforts to adapt the Tesseract open source OCR engine for multiple scripts and languages.

item.title: Improving the Cluster Structure Extracted from OPTICS Plots
item.description: Density-based clustering is closely associated with the two algorithms DBSCAN and OPTICS.

item.title: Scikit-learn: Machine Learning in Python
item.description: Scikit-learn is a Python module integrating a wide range of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms for medium-scale supervised and unsupervised problems.

item.title: SAGA: A Fast Incremental Gradient Method With Support for Non-Strongly Convex Composite Objectives
item.description: In this work we introduce a new optimisation method called SAGA in the spirit of SAG, SDCA, MISO and SVRG, a set of recently proposed incremental gradient algorithms with fast linear convergence rates.

item.title: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
item.description: In this paper, we show an avenue for aligning language models with user intent on a wide range of tasks by fine-tuning with human feedback.

item.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
item.description: By contrast, humans can generally perform a new language task from only a few examples or from simple instructions - something which current NLP systems still largely struggle to do.

item.title: Llama 2: Open Foundation and Fine-Tuned Chat Models
item.description: In this work, we develop and release Llama 2, a collection of pretrained and fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) ranging in scale from 7 billion to 70 billion parameters.

item.title: GQA: Training Generalized Multi-Query Transformer Models from Multi-Head Checkpoints
item.description: Multi-query attention (MQA), which only uses a single key-value head, drastically speeds up decoder inference.

item.title: Transfer Learning from Speaker Verification to Multispeaker Text-To-Speech Synthesis
item.description: Clone a voice in 5 seconds to generate arbitrary speech in real-time

item.title: Efficient Neural Audio Synthesis
item.description: The small number of weights in a Sparse WaveRNN makes it possible to sample high-fidelity audio on a mobile CPU in real time.

item.title: Generalized End-to-End Loss for Speaker Verification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new loss function called generalized end-to-end (GE2E) loss, which makes the training of speaker verification models more efficient than our previous tuple-based end-to-end (TE2E) loss function.
